assertions.assertion: The pthread_kill() function requests from the kernel to deliver a specified signal be to a specified thread.
Just like in the kill() function, error checking shall be performed but no signal shall actually be sent, if sig is zero.
The function shall return a value of zero, upon successful completion.
The function shall return an error number otherwise.
No signal shall be sent if the pthread_kill() function fails.
[EINVAL] The value of the sig argument is an invalid or unsupported signal number.
The pthread_kill () function shall not return an error code of [EINTR].
